MeasurementToolMetadata.Description: The reactions to research participation questionnaire for parents (RRPQ-P)

rrpq1.Description: Being in this study was boring

rrpq2.Description: I am glad that I was in this study

rrpq3.Description: It was my choice if I was in the study (I could have said no even if other people wanted me to say yes)

rrpq4.Description: Being in this study made me feel upset or sad

rrpq5.Description: The things I said will stay private (no one else will know I said them)

rrpq6.Description: I am sorry I was in this study

rrpq7.Description: Being in this study made me feel good about myself

rrpq8.Description: I was told the truth about the study before it started

rrpq9.Description: I feel good about helping other people by being in this study

rrpq10.Description: I knew I could skip questions or parts of the study if I wanted to

rrpq11.Description: I knew I could stop at any time

rrpq12.Description: I knew I could ask to take a break whenever I wanted

rrpq_neg.Description: Negative appraisals - subscale (sum of items 1, 4, & 6 - reversed)

rrpq_trust.Description: Trust and understanding of informed consent - subscale (sum of items 3, 5, & 8)

rrpq_rights.Description: Understanding of one's rights during participation - subscale (sum of items 10, 11, & 12)
